w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach words about our world by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
continents, North America, South America, Australia, Antarctica, Europe, Asia, Africa, What continent is this, north, south, east, west,
n of this lesson, students will be able to:
e the words for continents, countries, states and cities
sets of words in complete sentences
continents, North America, South America, Australia, Antarctica, Europe, Asia, Africa
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about the world!”
Try to sing the song with
Sing the song to the child. Encourage the child to join in a second time.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
Explain that continents are BIG pieces of land (make your hands big to show this adjective).
Explain that some countries say we have 5, 6, or 7 continents. Today we are going to study the 7.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
on the screen. Have the child repeat.
Draw arrows pointing north, south, east and west
Review the compass rose (from the Using a Map lesson). Explain what each letter stands for.
Model drawing an arrow going north. Say, “This arrow is pointing north. Can you draw an arrow pointing south?” Help the child as needed. Repeat with all the directions.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct continent: North America
What animals live in North America?
I see an eagle, I see a raccoon, I see
OR I see birds and animals
Circle the continent and say, “What continent is this?” Encourage the child to say
Ask, “What animals live in North America?” and circle one of the animals. Say the name of animals and have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
by writing the missing letters in the blanks to the right
by filling in the missing letters. Clear the screen and have the child repeat.
Extension: If the child is from South America, ask “Are you from South America? What country are you from?” Have child indicate, if possible, where they live on the map.
Draw a line from the correct direction (North, South) to the continent
Circle the correct directional symbol on the compass rose for each continent
and circle the compass rose. Encourage the child to say it is in the north. Repeat with South America.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct continent:
Circle the continent and say, “What continent is this?” Encourage the child to say
Ask, “What animals live in South America?” and circle one of the animals. Say the name of animals and have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
. Model if the child needs help.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct continent:
kangaroo, I see a koala bear
Circle the continent and say, “What continent is this?” Encourage the child to say
Ask, “What animals live in Australia?” and circle one of the animals. Say the name of animals and have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
. Model if the child needs help.

? What country are you from?” Have child indicate, if possible, where they live on the map.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct continent:
Circle the continent and say, “What continent is this?” Encourage the child to say
Ask, “What animals live in Asia?” and circle one of the animals. Say the name of animals and have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
in the spiral a couple times. Clear the screen and have the child do the same.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct continent:
Circle the continent and say, “What continent is this?” Encourage the child to say
Ask, “What animals live in Africa?” and circle one of the animals. Say the name of animals and have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
in the rainbow arc. Have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
by saying each letter while touching a finger
by touching a finger for every letter of the word. Have the child repeat.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct continent: A
Circle the continent and say, “What continent is this?” Encourage the child to say
Ask, “What animals live in Antarctica?” and circle one of the animals. Say the name of animals and have the child repeat.
Draw a line from the correct sight word to the continent on the map
Say the name of each continent while drawing the line
You may need to assist the student with the first sight word, and with some thereafter.
Depending on nationality, you may wish to begin with the student’s continent
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
continents, North America, South America, Australia, Antarctica, Europe, Asia, Africa
continents, North America, South America, Australia, Antarctica, Europe, Asia, Africa
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
continents, North America, South America, Australia, Antarctica, Europe, Asia, Africa
through pictures. One prompt at a time.

Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
continents, North America, South America, Australia, Antarctica, Europe, Asia, Africa
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
